p: Fasseas et al. [ 113] investigated the antioxidant activity in meat treated with oregano. The results indicated that the essential oil treatments decreased the oxidation, while the heat treatment and storage time significantly affected the antioxidant activity of the meat [ 113]. The effect of light salting, modified atmosphere packaging and addition of oregano essential oil showed a positive effect on the shelf-life of sea bream ( Sparus aurata) [ 114]. The essential oil of Origanum vulgare has been evaluated in patients infected with enteric parasites such as Blastocystis hominis, Entamoeba hartmanni, and Endolimax nana. In 7 out of 11 patients that were positive for Blastocystis hominis, improvement was observed [ 115]. Initial studies with the essential oil from Origanum vulgare and Origanum compactum have shown a mild effect in vitro on Plasmodium falciparum [ 116].
